subject: Re: [junit] Junit used for Eclipse UI based Interface
msgSnippet: The asterisk * means install all plugins that match that pattern.
messageBody:
The asterisk "*" means install all plugins that match that pattern.

On Sep 22, 2006, at 6:02 PM, Kamal Ahmed wrote:

> Tim,
>
> For some reason: the link : 2. install abbot.* eclipse plugins
> http://abbot.sourceforge.net/wiki/index.php/Install_abbot.%
> 2A_eclipse_plugin
> s
> Does not work.
>
> Here is a section from the Wiki.
>
> to work from Eclipse with a workbench plugin
>
> 1. install eclipse. For now we'll assume you know how to do
> this :-) but
> see IMPORTANT note on SWT and Eclipse
> 2. install abbot.* eclipse plugins
> 3. run the standalone abbot.swt API demo with Eclipse's JUnit
> tooling
> 4. run your tests using Test Collector (IBM-only)
> 5. run your tests using PDE JUnit
>
> I am not sure on how to incorporate abbot in Eclipse.
>
> I would appreciate any help that you can provide.
>
> Thanks,
> -Kamal.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
> Behalf Of
> Timothy Wall
> Sent: Friday, September 22, 2006 5:28 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Cc: Abbot Users
> Subject: Re: [junit] Junit used for Eclipse UI based Interface
>
> Actually, it's for SWT too. There are packages for GEF support and
> others.
> Someone else packages up the SWT releases, but they are available --
> see the abbot-users list archive for details.
>
> T.
>
> On Sep 22, 2006, at 12:24 AM, Kamal Ahmed wrote:
>
>> Tim,
>>
>> Abbot is for AWT and Swing, I am using Eclipse UI API.
>> I am not sure if that would work in my case. But thanks.
>> -Kamal.
>>
>> -----Original Message-----
>> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On
>> Behalf Of
>> Timothy Wall
>> Sent: Thursday, September 21, 2006 7:29 PM
>> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
>> Subject: Re: [junit] Junit used for Eclipse UI based Interface
>>
>> A number of people are using abbot (http://abbot.sf.net) for SWT.
>> The library is designed for component-level testing. There is a
>> higher scripting layer more tailored to testing applications.
>>
>
> Timothy Wall
> http://abbot.sf.net
